alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Jefferson; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 1:47AM CDT until June 26 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Cocke County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 315 AM EDT. * At 247 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Parrottsville to near Dandridge, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Newport, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, Pittman Center, Del Rio, Bird Crossing, Fairgarden, Bybee and Chestnut Hill. This includes Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 427 and 451. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
